image.altText: A man stares at the camera with a blank expression.

props.synopsis: Central Victorian traditional owner group Dja Dja Wurrung has taken a "historic" step towards seeking a state-first local treaty with the government.

title.children: First Nations group seeks local treaty in Victorian premier's electorate

image.altText: Two men stand back while another man wields a machete.

props.synopsis: Detectives say seven males aged between 15 and 21 have been arrested and charged over an allegedly planned gang fight with machetes at Northland shopping centre on Sunday.

title.children: Total of seven young males involved in 'planned' gang fight at Northland, police allege

image.altText: Bronwyn stands in front of large piles of soils with organe markers next to them.

props.synopsis: Cattle carcasses are buried and composted on a research farm in north-east Victoria in preparation for an emergency disease outbreak.

title.children: Dead cattle composted on research farm to prepare for foot and mouth

image.altText: A table with lots of long knives laid out.

props.synopsis: Victoria will introduce a ban today on selling machetes after knife-wielding youth gangs brawled at a shopping centre in Melbourne's north. Here's what we know.

title.children: Victoria will ban machete sales from today. Here's what we know

image.altText: A 'sold' sticker being placed on a 'for auction' sign outside a house.

props.synopsis: The Victorian opposition has used its budget reply to showcase a pledge to scrap stamp duty for first home buyers on properties up to $1 million if it wins government next year.

title.children: Warning opposition plan to scrap stamp duty on first homes could push prices up

image.altText: Braydon and Gavin Boggitt moving with the help of a carer.

props.synopsis: More people have been left scrambling in the wake of a disability accommodation company shutting down operations, including subcontractors, a former AFL footballer and a finance group from Asia.

title.children: Contractors, investors left scrambling after disability housing provider shutdown

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: A week after hosting her in-laws for a deadly mushroom lunch, Erin Patterson told police officers she was still trying to understand what had gone fatally wrong, a murder trial jury has heard.

title.children: 'I loved them': Erin Patterson's police interview played to court

image.altText: A metal sign on a wall reads "children's court"

props.synopsis: A Victorian teenager has been charged with terror offences, with his father saying he has not seen the charges against his son.

title.children: Victorian teen charged with multiple terror offences

image.altText: A man with a shaved head and a light beard wears a puffer jacket while sitting at a desk with a computer on it.

props.synopsis: Council Watch says it holds local governments to account. Some Victorian councillors say it is actually "ground zero" for misinformation and abuse.

title.children: Victorian councillors accuse pro-ratepayer group of 'vile' attacks

image.altText: A machete

props.synopsis: The government is struggling to define and stick to its political narrative, while grappling with a law-and-order problem.

title.children: As shoppers ran in horror, Victoria's premier went into survival mode

image.altText: A phone screen glows with a map of Launceston while mounted on a phone holder inside a car at dusk.

props.synopsis: A member of a prominent Melbourne family has been accused of being involved in unconscionable conduct in a bitter court battle involving a serial fraudster and a US lawsuit against Uber.

title.children: Melbourne businessman named in court battle involving rideshare giant Uber

image.altText: aerial image of bitumen road dividing canola crop

props.synopsis: The strongest growth was in Victoria's Wimmera region, where land values have increased by 800 per cent in the last 20 years, according to the Australian Property Institute.

title.children: Farmland value increase exceeds all other property types, report finds

image.altText: A ute on a road with a hazy orange sky.

props.synopsis: Police are directing traffic in Mildura as a dust storm sweeps over the regional Victorian city.

title.children: Mildura 'battens down the hatches' as dust storm takes over

image.altText: Callum Mills of the Swans reacts after a heavy tackle on Charlie Spargo of the Demons

props.synopsis: Callum Mills's long-awaited AFL comeback is on hold, with the Sydney captain to serve a one-game suspension for rough conduct.

title.children: Mills handed one-match ban for high bump on Demon

image.altText: A photo of a river that has broken its banks in Port Fairy with water under a table and chairs.

props.synopsis: The SES prepares sandbags as abnormally high tides threaten to flood low-lying coastal areas across Victoria.

title.children: Victoria's coast on alert amid flood threat from high tides

image.altText: Dozens of shoppers run towards the Northland exits.

props.synopsis: Two teenagers alleged to be the main offenders in a violent brawl between "rival gangs" at a Melbourne shopping centre were on bail at the time.

title.children: Victoria to ban machete sales this week after gang brawl at shopping centre

image.altText: man walking outside with phone in hand

props.synopsis: A Victorian judge discharges a jury in the trial of ex-AFL player Nick Stevens, after learning she has prosecuted him in a previous case.

title.children: Jury discharged in dishonesty case against ex-AFL player Nick Stevens

image.altText: A non-identifiable child playing with toys.

props.synopsis: The By Five Early Years Initiative, created in western Victoria, helps hundreds of children access specialist health services, but its future remains uncertain after it lost Victorian government funding.

title.children: Award-winning children's health initiative misses out on budget funding

image.altText: A man smiling with pearly whites. SES vehicles in background.

props.synopsis: Portland's Ray and Melissa Polaski are SES peer support officers who travel to be with personnel after traumatic critical incidents.

title.children: Father and daughter duo support SES volunteers after trauma

image.altText: Police cars line up in a street where a woman was shot by a police officer.

props.synopsis: A 34-year-old woman was fatally shot after allegedly hitting a police officer with a vehicle. The police officer has been discharged from hospital.

title.children: Investigation continues into fatal police shooting in South Melbourne

image.altText: Elderly man seated playing an accordion inside a winery, surrounded by wine bottles and plants.

props.synopsis: Victoria's King Valley, once home to post-war Italian tobacco farmers, is earning global recognition for its climate-resilient Italian grape varieties.

title.children: Migrant families transform tiny valley into Italian wine hub

image.altText: A player holds the ball overhead and looks to make her next pass

props.synopsis: Although Super Netball team sizes have increased, the league's First Nations cohort has shrunk. As Wakka Wakka woman Leesa Mi Mi experiences the same isolation her sister Jemma did five years earlier.

title.children: Oh Mi Mi, Super Netball's Indigenous representation has shrunk

image.altText: Police tape.

props.synopsis: Police say a man was found dead at a property in Glenroy on Sunday. It's believed an altercation took place at the property the previous evening.

title.children: Homicide detectives investigate death in Melbourne's north

image.altText: The colourful exterior of the Afghan Gallery restaurant on Brunswick Street.

props.synopsis: After 44 years, it's a bittersweet end for the tight-knit family behind the Melbourne institution Afghan Gallery — and the community it has warmly embraced.

title.children: One of Australia's oldest Afghan restaurants set to close after 44 years

image.altText: A crash scene.

props.synopsis: A motorcyclist has died after colliding with a car and then being hit by another vehicle at Colac west.

title.children: Motorcyclist dies in crash west of Melbourne

image.altText: A woman with long light brown hair in a white top with floral pattern stares at the camera.

props.synopsis: A company that manages at least 140 disability homes in Queensland is being accused of making misleading claims to property investors.

title.children: Retiree 'forced back to work' after investing in disability accommodation

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: A web of messages, search histories, and reset phones has emerged in the Erin Patterson trial. But can digital evidence explain what happened at her dinner table?

title.children: Mother, cook, defendant: Trial of Erin Patterson turns to her personal life

image.altText: A street sign at the intersection of Beechwoth-Wangaratta Road in Everton Upper.

props.synopsis: One person has died and three others, including a seven-year-old child, are in hospital following a two-car collision in Victoria's north-east.

title.children: Crash in Everton Upper kills 74yo driver, three others injured

image.altText: A man stares contemplatively out over the ocean

props.synopsis: The Yoorrook Justice Commission's deputy chair embarks on a 25-day, 400-kilometre Walk For Truth to Melbourne to hand a report to Victoria's Parliament House.

title.children: Walking 400km in the footsteps of historic Indigenous leaders

image.altText: GettyImages-2210971209

props.synopsis: Damien Hardwick tells the Saints to focus on their own backyard after Ross Lyon called the Suns the 'nepo baby' of the AFL.

title.children: 'Disrespectful': Hardwick hits out at Lyon over 'nepo baby' comment

image.altText: A woman with long bright red hair, wearing all black, walks down the street, smiling.

props.synopsis: Union boss Diana Asmar had a clear message for her branch: The traitors who had betrayed her had no idea what was coming. But it was she who took the fall.

title.children: 'Traitors will get what's coming': How a powerbroker fell from her throne

image.altText: Tim Wilson and Zoe Daniel.

props.synopsis: Following the completion of a full distribution of preferences in the inner-Melbourne seat on Saturday, giving Liberal candidate Tim Wilson a win by 260 votes, independent MP Zoe Daniel has asked for a recount, claiming "errors" and "votes moving to and fro in the final stages of the count".

title.children: Zoe Daniel calls for recount after Tim Wilson wins Goldstein by 260 votes

image.altText: cfa helmet on coffin with flowers

props.synopsis: Hundreds of people attend the funeral of firefighter Simon Lund, who spent his dying days seeking a better deal for others like him with a terminal illness related to their work.

title.children: Much-loved campaigner for fairer go for firefighters remembered

image.altText: An orange winged butterfly floats on a purple bush

props.synopsis: "Monarch mother" Ellen Reid has been breeding and releasing butterflies for 50 years, which then travel all over Australia.

title.children: The butterfly breeding effect that's given a town its wings

image.altText: An aerial shot of a small town.

props.synopsis: Fosterville Gold Mine is given the go-ahead to expand by the state's planning minister, despite concerns from nearby residents who say the mine causes noise, dust and vibrations in their homes.

title.children: Biggest gold mine in Victoria greenlit to grow despite neighbours' woes
